intro: Mairia pustulata, commonly known as the roughleaf mairia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Mairia pustulata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
